topic.title: Using the Domain List Window
topic.p: The Domain List displays all domains currently configured for this account.

ol.title: To view the Domain List:

li.p: In the Domain Management menu group, click Domain List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li:
Click the Display Domains of drop-down list, and select the domain administrator for the domains you want to
view.
Click Go. The Domain List window refreshes displaying a list of the domains you want.

ol.title: To add a domain:

li.p: In the Domain Management menu group, click Add Domain (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.
The Add Domain: Setup window appears.

ol.li: Next to Domain Admin, from the Add the domain to the following user drop-down list, select the domain administrator.

Next to Domain, type the user's domain name.
Note: After a domain is added, the domain name cannot be changed.
Next to IP Address, select the IP address for the domain.

Next to Web Services, select the web services you want to enable. Enabling CGI permits CGI scripts in the domain's cgi-bin directory. Enabling SSL permits secure HTTPS connection using a shared certificate.
Next to End Users, select the number of end users you want to allow the domain administrator to create.
Next to Email Addresses, select the number of email addresses you want to allow the domain administrator to create.
Next to Website Logs, select the Website log options you want.

ul.li: Select Do not create or store website logs if you do not want the site to use logs.
Select Create and store website logs if you want to use third-party stats packages.
Select Never rotate website logs if you do not want to delete any logs.
Click Rotate and select the frequency of the log rotation you want from the associated drop-down menu.
Select the number of logs you want to save from the and save drop-down menu.

ol.li: Next to Domain Contact, type the email address of the person to be contacted if error messages are generated for the domain.

Next to Mail Catchall, select the option you want.
Select Reject mail - return as unknown user if you want misaddressed mail returned to the user with an “unknown user” reply message.
Select Silently discard mail if you want misaddressed mail deleted without a reply message sent to the sender.
Select Deliver mail to Domain Admin if you want misaddressed mail sent to the email address of the domain administrator.
Select Deliver mail to: if you want misaddressed mail delivered to the email address you type in the associated field. If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.
Note: If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.

When you are finished, click Next. The Add Domain Preview window appears displaying the options you have selected for this domain. To make any changes, click Previous, make the desired changes, then click Next to go to the Preview window.

Click Save/Create Another if you want to create another domain. A message appears confirming that the domain has been added and the window refreshes with blank fields. If you do not want to create another domain, click Save. A message appears confirming that the domain has been added.

ol.title: To edit a domain:

li.p: In the Domain Management menu group, click Domain List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li: From the Display Domains of drop-down list, select the domain administrator of the domain you want to edit and click Go. The domain List window for that domain administrator appears.
In the Actions column, click properties for the domain you want to edit. The Properties window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain Setup, click Edit. The Edit Domain Setup window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain, you can disable or enable this domain's alias.
Next to IP Address, select the IP address for the domain.

Next to Web Services, select the web services you want to enable. Enabling CGI permits CGI scripts in the domain's cgi-bin directory. Enabling SSL permits secure HTTPS connection using a shared certificate.
Next to End Users, select the number of end users you want to allow the Domain administrator to create. Select An unlimited number of end users if you do not want to limit the number of end users.

Next to Email Addresses, select the number of email addresses you want to allow the Domain administrator to create. Select An unlimited number of email addresses if you do not want to limit the number of email addresses.

Select the Website log options you want:
Select Do not create or store website logs if you do not want the site to use logs.
Select Create and store website logs if you want to use third-party stats packages.
Select Never rotate website logs if you do not want to delete any logs.
Click Rotate and select the frequency of the log rotation you want from the associated drop-down menu.
Select the number of logs you want to save from the and save drop-down menu.
Next to Domain Contact, type the email address of the person to be contacted if error messages are generated for the domain.

Next to Mail Catchall, select the option you want:
Select Reject mail - return as unknown user if you want misaddressed mail returned to the user with an “unknown user”
reply message.
Select Silently discard mail if you want misaddressed mail deleted without a reply message sent to the sender.
Select Deliver mail to Domain Admin if you want misaddressed mail sent to the email address of the domain
administrator.
Select Deliver mail to: if you want misaddressed mail delivered to the email address you type in the associated field.
If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.
Note: If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.
Click Save. A message appears informing you that the domain has been saved.

ol.title: To delete a domain:

li.p: In the Domain Management menu group, click Domain List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.p:
Note: Before you can delete a domain, you must delete all accounts configured under it. Deleting an account permanently
removes all that domain's information and mail from the server.
ol.li:
In the Actions column, click delete for the domain you want to delete. A message appears asking if you are sure
you want to delete this domain.

Click OK. The window refreshes with that domain deleted from the list and a message informing you that the
selected domain has been deleted.

ol.title: To disable a domain:

li.p: In the Domain Management menu group, click Domain List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.p:
Note: Disabling a domain temporarily freezes the features associated with that domain. The users’ settings and mail are
not deleted. While in a disabled state, all users (domain administrator and End Users) associated with this domain are unable to retrieve mail
or access the account through the Control Panel, FTP, or shell.
ol.li:
In the Actions column, click disable for the domain you want to disable. A message appears asking if you are
sure you want to disable this domain.

Click OK. The window refreshes with a message informing you that the selected domain has been disabled. The word
"disabled" appears in the Status column for that domain.

ol.title: To enable a domain:

li.p: In the Domain Management menu group, click Domain List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li:
In the Actions column, click enable for the domain you want to enable. The window refreshes with a message
informing you that the selected domain has been enabled. The word "enabled" appears in the Status column for that domain.
